brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study was to evaluate the clinical control program in patients with
      hypothyroidism during pregnancy (suggested in resent guidelines). Is it possible by
      monitoring the patients every 4. week during pregnancy to keep the thyroid function
      parameters within the recommended range?

      A retrospective study of  consecutive pregnant women with hypothyroidism followed at the
      outpatient clinic at the Endocrinology Unit, Herlev Hospital, Denmark during 2012. Patients
      selected through electronic medical system. Blood tests for the The hormone levels  drawn
      from the laboratory of Clinical Biochemical Department, Herlev Hospital

clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring and Evaluation of the Levothyroxin Replacement Therapy in Pregnant Women With Hypothyroidism

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Consecutive pregnant women with L-T4 treated hypothyroidism followed at the
             outpatient clinic at the Endocrinology Unit, Herlev Hospital, Denmark during 2012

study_pop.textblock:
A retrospective study of  consecutive pregnant women with L-T4 treated hypothyroidism
        followed at the outpatient clinic at the Endocrinology Unit, Herlev Hospital, Denmark
        during 2012

intervention.description: Evaluation of  abnormal blodtests (evaluating thyroid function)  from predefined control program

facility.name: Endocrine Unit O, Herlev Hospital, University of Copenhagen

clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring and Evaluation of the Levothyroxin Replacement Therapy in Pregnant Women

overall_official.affiliation: Endocrine Unit O, Herlev Hospital, University of Copenahgen

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.measure: number of patients with thyroid function parameters within the intended level

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
